# Contributing to Homelab Infrastructure

Thank you for your interest in this project! This is a personal learning project and portfolio piece showcasing production-ready infrastructure implementation.

## üìñ Using This Project as a Learning Resource

This repository is intended to:

- ‚úÖ Demonstrate enterprise infrastructure patterns
- ‚úÖ Showcase DevOps/SRE best practices
- ‚úÖ Provide comprehensive documentation examples
- ‚úÖ Inspire your own homelab projects

### How to Learn from This Project

**1. Start with Documentation**
- Read [docs/README.md](../docs/README.md) for structure overview
- Review [Architecture Decision Records](../docs/00-foundation/decisions/) to understand "why"
- Study [service guides](../docs/10-services/guides/) for operational knowledge

**2. Explore Architecture Diagrams**
- See [ARCHITECTURE-DIAGRAMS.md](../docs/ARCHITECTURE-DIAGRAMS.md) for visual representations
- Understand security layers, network segmentation, data flows

**3. Study Real Problem-Solving**
- Read [deployment journals](../docs/30-security/journal/) for troubleshooting examples
- Learn from challenges and solutions documented throughout

**4. Adapt to Your Environment**
- Fork the repository
- Replace `example.com` with your domain
- Customize service selection to your needs
- Follow deployment patterns documented in [CLAUDE.md](../CLAUDE.md)

## üôÖ Not Accepting Pull Requests

This is a **showcase of personal work** demonstrating:
- My problem-solving approach
- My documentation style
- My architecture decisions

**For this reason, I'm not accepting pull requests.**

This doesn't mean your input isn't valuable! See below for how you can contribute.

## üí¨ How You Can Help

### Open Issues for Discussions

I welcome:

- ‚ùì **Questions** - "How did you solve X?"
- üí° **Ideas** - "Have you considered Y?"
- üêõ **Bug Reports** - "Documentation says X but should say Y"
- üìö **Learning Questions** - "Can you explain Z?"

**Please open GitHub issues for:**
- Clarification on architectural decisions
- Questions about implementation details
- Suggestions for documentation improvements
- Discussions about alternative approaches

### Share Your Experience

If this project helped you:

- ‚≠ê **Star the repository** - Shows appreciation, helps others find it
- üîó **Link to it** - Share in blog posts, discussions, social media
- üí¨ **Tell me about it** - Open an issue sharing how you used/adapted it

### Forking and Adapting

You're encouraged to:

1. **Fork this repository** for your own homelab
2. **Adapt the patterns** to your environment
3. **Learn and experiment** with the architecture
4. **Share your adaptations** (link back if you blog about it!)

**Note:** If you fork and improve something significantly, feel free to open an issue sharing your approach. I might incorporate ideas in future iterations.

## üìù Documentation Standards

If you find documentation issues (typos, broken links, outdated info), please open an issue with:

- File path and line number
- What's wrong
- Suggested correction (if applicable)

I'll review and update as part of regular maintenance.

## üéì Learning Resources

### Related to This Project

**Container Orchestration:**
- [Podman Documentation](https://docs.podman.io/)
- [systemd for Administrators](https://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/systemd/)

**Monitoring & Observability:**
- [Prometheus Documentation](https://prometheus.io/docs/)
- [Grafana Tutorials](https://grafana.com/tutorials/)
- [Loki Documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/loki/)

**Security:**
- [Authelia Documentation](https://www.authelia.com/)
- [FIDO2/WebAuthn Specification](https://fidoalliance.org/fido2/)
- [OWASP Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-top-ten/)

**Architecture Decision Records:**
- [ADR GitHub](https://adr.github.io/)
- [Documenting Architecture Decisions](https://cognitect.com/blog/2011/11/15/documenting-architecture-decisions)

### General Homelab Resources

- [r/homelab](https://reddit.com/r/homelab) - Active community
- [r/selfhosted](https://reddit.com/r/selfhosted) - Self-hosting discussions
- [Awesome Selfhosted](https://github.com/awesome-selfhosted/awesome-selfhosted) - Curated list

## ü§ù Code of Conduct

Be respectful and constructive:

- Assume good intent
- Focus on learning and sharing knowledge
- Keep discussions technical and professional
- Respect that this is a personal project
